citation.article-title: Phylogenic and phenotypic characterization of some Eubacterium-like isolates from human feces: description of Solobacterium moorei gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Solobacterium (So.lo. L.a solus, sole Gr. Dim n. bakterion a small rod; M.L. neut. n. Solusbacterium sole bacterium)
The species is Gram-positive and obligately anaerobic.
Fermentation products of glucose are mainly acetic, lactic, and butyric acids; pyruvic acid is produced in a smaller amount.
DNA G+C content is 37 to 39 mol%.
The type species is S. moorei.
The genus Solusbacterium is a member of the Clostridium subphylum of Gram-positive bacteria and exhibits a close phylogenetic association with H. filiformis and E. rhusiopathiae.
